H0.text: who were the nationalist in the spanish civil war. Falange Española

H1.text: who were the nationalist in the spanish civil war. Carlists

H2.text: who were the nationalist in the spanish civil war. Spanish Army

H3.text: who were the nationalist in the spanish civil war. the CEDA

A4.text: Falange Española de las JONS was one of the original supporters of the military coup d\u2019état against the republic, the other being the Carlists.

A5.text: The Carlists along with the Falange were the original supporters of the military coup d\u2019état against the republic.

A6.text: The Falange's electoral results during the Second Republic were consistently very poor. This lack of success was due to several reasons, including the absence of a deeply rooted nationalism in Spain.

A7.text: The Falange were militarist in that they wanted a strong military to ensure Spanish independence and Spanish status in the world as a whole.

A8.text: Spanish Carlists with Franco battled and defeated Basque nationalists in 1936–1937.
